Row.Text: +{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent to Camps.

Elayne Trakand, by the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, Protector of the People, High Seat of House Trakand. Acknowledged to be potentially one of the greatest Queens of Andor since its founding, she has shown intellect, delicacy and diplomacy in her doings and is an accomplished player at Daes Dae'mar.
Egwene is one of the strongest female channelers seen in over a thousand years. he is also the first Aes Sedai Dreamer to have been discovered since Corianin Nedeal, who died approximately 473 years.
Easar Togita, of House Togita, is the King of Shienar. He led the Shienaran troops into battle at Tarwin's Gap to battle the Trollocs.

Ethenielle Kirukon Materasu, after her marriage with Brys Noramaga, Ethenielle Cosaru Noramaga is the Queen of Kandor, residing in Aesdaishar Palace. Her full title is "Her Most Illuminated Majesty, Ethenielle Cosaru Noramaga, By the Blessing of the Light, Queen of Kandor, Protector of the Land, Shield of the North, High Seat of House Noramaga.
Her Illumined Majesty, Tenobia si Bashere Kazadi, Shield of the North and Sword of the Blightborder, High Seat of House Kazadi, Lady of Shahayni, Asnelle, Kunwar and Ganai was Queen of Saldaea.

Galldrian su Riatin rie was king of Cairhien from 978 NE, after Laman Damodred's death at the end of the Aiel War. Galldrian was an unremarkable ruler for the most part, although not prone to quite the same excesses as his predecessor.
Tylin Quintara Mitsobar, by the Grace of the Light, was the Queen of Altara, Mistress of the Four Winds, Guardian of the Sea of Storms, and High Seat of House Mitsobar.

Pedron Niall was the Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light. The ruling body of Amadicia is historically a king, most recently King Ailron, but the Children of the Light were the real ruling power in Amadicia.
Blessed of the Light, Defender of Garen's Wall, Alliandre Maritha Kigarin is Queen of Ghealdan.

Amathera Aelfdene Casmir Lounault is a Taraboner noblewoman who was raised to the position of Panarch of Tarabon. Although Amathera seemed to have no clue as to what the lives of the common people were like when she is raised as Panarch, Elayne thought that she had a true concern for justice.

Alsalam Saeed Almadar was the king of Arad Doman, Lord of Almadar, High Seat of House Almadar. Alsalam was considered a good ruler for around twenty years, which made his sudden shift toward chaotic orders very suspicious. These more recent orders, supposedly issued by King Alsalam, were, in actuality, coming from Graendal.

Fortuona Athaem Devi Paendrag is the current Empress of the Seanchan, the Daughter of the Nine Moons, the second and favorite daughter of the late Empress of the Seanchan empire. She is believed to be a direct descendant of Artur Hawkwing through his son Luthair, who conquered the Seanchan continent.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on a continent other that your [ICON_Capital] Capital's.

Rhuarc is the clan chief of the Taardad Aiel. The Taardad are one of the twelve Aiel clans. Their clan hold is Cold Rocks Hold. The Taardad are the staunchest of Randâ€™s supporters. They are not friendly with the Shaido Aiel, finding them shifty and underhanded.

Ishamael , previously known as Elan Morin Tedronai, was the most powerful of the Forsaken and their de facto leader during the War of Power. Later, he was officially granted the title of Nae'blis and given direct authority over all of the Dark One's other followers.

Rand al'Thor born in the year 978 NE on the slopes of Dragonmount during the final hours of the Aiel War is the Dragon Reborn, the champion of the Light in the battle against the Dark One, the prophesied savior and breaker of the world, and the reincarnated soul of Lews Therin Telamon. To the Aiel he is the Car'a'carn, or He Who Comes with the Dawn, and to the Atha'an Miere he is the Coramoor.
Perrin Aybara, born in the year 978 NE is a strong ta'veren, a wolfbrother, and has exceptional skills in manipulating Tel'aran'rhiod.
Matrim Cauthon, born in the year 978 NE is the Marshal-General of the Band of the Red Hand, as well as one of the greatest generals the world has ever seen.
Morgase Trakand, full former title by the Grace of the Light, Queen of Andor, Defender of the Realm, Protector of the People, High Seat of House Trakand, is the ruler of Andor.
Siuan Sanche was an Aes Sedai of the Blue Ajah. She was born in Tear, and grew up a fisher girl. But now, she is the Amyrlin Seat.
Elaida do Avriny a'Roihan is an Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, and the Amyrlin Seat in the White Tower. She was also the only Amyrlin raised from the Red Ajah in the New Era.
Couladin was a warrior of the Domai sept of the Shaido Aiel and the Seia Doon warrior society. Now is the Clan Chief of the Shaido Aiel.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in Desert and Plains

Demandred previously known as Barid Bel Medar and known in Shara as Bao the Wyld, was one of the thirteen Forsaken trapped at Shayol Ghul due to the Dragon's sealing at the end of the Age of Legends, and released back into the world in the summer of 998 NE.

Sammael, formerly known as Tel Janin Aellinsar, was one of the thirteen Forsaken who was trapped at Shayol Ghul due to the Dragon's sealing. He was a world-renowned sportsman in the Age of Legends and one of the Light's greatest generals, until he defected. Sammael used the alias Lord Brend in Illian and quickly taking over the Council of Nine in Illian.

Rahvin, formerly known as Ared Mosinel, was one of the thirteen Forsaken who were trapped at Shayol Ghul due to the Dragon's sealing. He used the alias of Lord Gaebril in Andor. His strength in the power is ++1, the highest ranking possible, putting him above almost all other channelers. The rumors of Morgase's death at his hands led Rahvin to make his own claim upon the throne earlier than planned, with his personal brigade of soldiers, the White Lions, as enforcers.
Be'lal, formerly known as Duram Laddel Cham, is one of the thirteen Forsaken who were trapped at Shayol Ghul due to the Dragon's sealing. He used the alias Lord Samon the High Lord of Tear.
Graendal, previously called Kamarile Maradim Nindar, is one of the thirteen servants of the Dark One known as the Forsaken.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Aes Sedai unit.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Legion of the Wall unit.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Deathwatch Guard unit.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one adjacent Maidens of the Spear unit.
+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production adjacency bonus from hills to Industrial Zone
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
All districts gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for being adjacent to the Coast.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
Your units receive double experience from battles they initiate.
Your cities have full [ICON_Housing] Housing from water, as if they were all next to a River.
All melee unit gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Hills
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to any city-state provide +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every specialty district in the origin city.
All districts gain +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith for being adjacent to the Coast.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for routes between your own cities.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
Teather gains +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for Forest adjacency.
Your cities earn +15% [ICON_Science] Science whenever you are not at war with any civilization.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 Faith [ICON_Faith].
Campus gains +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for Forest adjacency.
Campus gains +1 [ICON_Science] Science for Forest adjacency.
Holy Site gains +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Forest adjacency.
Commercial Hub gains +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for Forest adjacency.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 Science [ICON_Science].
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for routes between your own cities.
Your cities get +15% [ICON_Production] Production towards wonders.
Industrial Zone gains +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for Forest adjacency.
Teather gains +1 [ICON_Science] Science for Forest adjacency.
Teather gains +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Forest adjacency.
Your cities get +20% [ICON_Production] Production towards city projects.
Industrial Zone gains +1 [ICON_Production] Production for Forest adjacency.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +2 Culture [ICON_Culture].
Campus gains +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Forest adjacency.
Regional effects from your Industrial Zone and Entertainment Complex districts reach 3 tiles farther.
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Production] Production to adjacent tiles.
â€œI have taken the path down to the belly of Shayol Ghul, down the long way with stones like fangs brushing my head, to the shore of a lake of fire and molten rock.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Padan Fain
